intro: Carmichaelia australis var. egmontiana, commonly known as the Egmontia Carmichaelia, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often found in the Southern Alps and on the Egmont (Tongariro) volcano, where it adapts to harsh environmental conditions. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
